reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this games because like many others it reminds me of Escape velocity, and I love that type of game and story-telling. Deathwar Redux puts an Indiana Jones/Rebel Galaxy spin on that, and brings in other kinds of mechanics to make the game interesting(the warp drive/fuel system, nebulas, keeping upgrades). It did a great job of being its own kind of game, yet still relates to other games i loved. so i give it an 8.5/10


That said there a few small things:

-occasional sound bugs, music stops playing, SFX stop working
-maybe i missed something, so this could be inaccurate, but i'd like to see more story with Kent and Vasquez
-the game isn't skimpy on content, and story, but as an EV Fan, I'd like more story lines.


All in all, i enjoyed playing this game, and definitely recommend it to a like minded gamer(Read: loves EV like games)

To the Dev,

you created a great game, and you have a fun platform. I'd love to see how you expand on this story. I'll be back if you do.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I discovered the old version of this little gem a while ago and it was instant love, so i was really looking forward to see the new version on steam. It may be in early access, but the game is complete and will only expand on what exist and get better during this period.

This game touch a few genres and make winks to classic cult movies and games with its tongue-in-cheek dialogues and encounters, and also making use of with its artwork. This last aspect may not be the finest but it really does it works portraying familiar worlds and characters. Here you can see aspects not only other great space sim games, but also from games of the adventure genre: the main character is an Indiana Jones wannabe and those colorful yet shady space stations will give you this bladerunneresque feel...

Even if there are elements made with nostalgic purposes this is a game that stand on his own. It is well made technically, the fighting AI is great and provides you with a decent challenge, the fact that there several ways to earn money avoid grinding, the big open world encourages exploring, and the history is compelling and makes you want to play the next chapter to see how the plot evolve. Oh, and that soundtrack is a score! it is very varied, but it all sounds great. Sometimes adding to the retro half of the game and sometimes to the half futuristic.

Another aspect to take into account is that the devs are passionate and really eager for feedback and ideas to keep expanding the game.

So if you like old school spaceships, adventure or 2d games in general, this is a must have to your collection!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Full Disclosure: I recieved the key from the developer as a result of opting in during their early period on itch.io (i think is what it is called!)

I have been thoroughly enjoying 3030 Deathwar for quite a while. Ever since their release on itch.io (is that the right site?), this game has mesmerised me in how simple a space game can be but still have such a great depth. There is so much charm here, so much fantasy and comedy that just mixes in the perfect fashion.

My hours here on Redux are low for now, hoping that with all these great games coming out that I can still find the time to be in awe of this super simple, super deep space trading game.

So don't be discouraged by the tongue-in-cheek comedy or the seemingly crude artwork (the artstyle totally works, seriously give it some time!).

Do it for yourself. Do it for space games. And don't forget, keep your tractor beams warm and your passenger cabin empty! o7

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well what can I say about 3030 Deathwar Redux other than it's pretty awesome and fun?

First, the game is lively. There are lot's of NPC's flying around in-space, bantering and moving around in stations which makes the game feel alive.  The artwork colorful and thoughtout, though for some sprites I felt that a finer grain of detail would be an improvement, but isn't really an issue that hurt my experience at all.  There's lots of stuff to do, from mining asteroids to doing courier missions, to bounty hunting pirates, to looting derelict spacecraft.

I'm pretty satisfied with this game for the cost, so far I've sank in a few hours and it's been a lot of fun.  Looking forward to future updates.  Definitely recommend if you're looking for a fun space themed game.

If you're having issues getting the game to use your whole monitor in full screen, just select a resolution with the correct ratio as your monitor and make sure you're using the scaling options in your GPU control panel.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer: I donated money for the old free version and received a key to this new version.

This game is similar in a lot of ways to the legendary Escape Velocity series games, which I absolutely adored and played for hundreds of hours. There are some key differences however: stations you can move around, NPCs you can talk to, a fabulous sense of humour that pervades the writing and just this gritty Blade Runner meets Monty Python atmosphere that oozes from every crack of the run down stations. If you like being a space captain, enjoy quality flavour text and atmosphere, I think you'll love this game.

I threw some Pros/Cons list

Edit 10.05.2016
Developers actually work on the game.
This is biggest Pros that any game could have.

Pros:

Great fly mechanics
Nice pixel graphics
Pretty lasers particles
I like that nebulas labirinth

Cons:

The crew say GO F YOURSELF . we going on adventure without you. ( You see them 2-3 times through the play but they generally just tell you what they did )
Stupid AI and useless enemies (DogFight is absolutely crap)
Balanceless missions

Conclusion :

This game has adequate pricing.
I got bored only at the end of 8 hour playthrough.
Not bad 6.5\10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DISCLAIMER: The developer of this game gave me a copy because I donanted to the orginal release.
Also, most of my experience is with the orginal game and I'm still feeling out the new one.

3030 Deathwar is a good space game. It has all the top-down real-time space stuff you could ask for in a large open-roam universe, trading, quests, combat and even some adventure. The trading is simple but well implemented, stuff is worth more in different systems and you can play the market to your benefit while steadily upgrading to bigger and bigger ships. The quests are also well-done with the usual variation, combat, delivey, discovery, salvage, mining, bounty-hunting, etc. The combat is like a souped-up version of Asteriod, control your momentum, dodge the enemy's bullets and missle while firing your own.

The games main strengths lie in its writing and its music. While every station is much the same format of bar, hanger, trade and job areas, each character you encounter (and there are so many) has a little dialogue tree and intresting things to say. In fact, the adventuring and dialogue trees are great in that they call back to old choose-your-own-adventure and point'n'click adventure games while meshing into the actual space-flying-around-part. Also the music is great, up-beat and catchy pop for flying around and suitable instrumental stuff for the adventure parts.

The main weaknesses of the game came from it's Early Access nature. There aren't as many resolutions as you'd hope, there's no option to change the controls from flying with the arrows to flying with WASD (a personal bugbear of mine) and some the story quests aren't as flexible as they should be. For example, in an early story quest somebody was gunning for me and, being out-gunned, I ran away to another system. I was then treated to a little pixel cutscene implying I killed the guy I ran away from.

All-in-all though, a solid, quirky game they may actually end up sucking away hours upon hours of your time.

Early Access Review

Open World Space Adventure Gamehttps://youtu.be/ggiQ0vEW4B0
+ Open world with a huge galaxy to explore
+ Loads of upgrades, and new ships to buy
+ A variety of ways to earn money, at the start you could trade resources between stations, take on quests like delivering mail, transporting people, destroying debris, or go hunt down some bounties.
+ Excellent classic pop/electronic soundtrack that fit surprisingly well when traveling through space
+ Lots of dialogue options
+ Surprisingly easy to learn and get started, and you really do feel like it's your own story

This game is in Early Access so don't take these too seriously
- The User Interface is quite small

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm so chuffed to see 3030 Deathwar finally make it's way to Steam. The version before the Steam release kept me grasped for hours. I love the art style, the humour, the sound design, the music and the gameplay itself.  It's got a real Firefly vibe to it...

There are few niggles to do with controls, but I'm sure the proactive developer will sort those out with community feedback.

I really hope the game does well on Steam, and I thoroughly recommend it to all space game fans.

Disclaimer: I received a Steam key from the developers as I donated money when 3030 Deathwar was a pay what you want" release. The fact I donated (after I'd tried it and loved it) shows how good the game is

reviewText:
Early Access Review

3030 Deathwar Redux is an entertaining and exciting romp through the galaxy that will keep you entertained for hours. This version is an updated version of CrunchyLeaf's original offering that includes new graphics and extra polish over it's older version that was available on itch.io.

Explore the galaxy, upgrade your ship, it's weapon systems and cargo capacity. Take on missions from different space stations ferrying goods or transporting people. Mine resources and make friends and enemies. The game has a very interesting storyline that is told in little vignettes in between your exploring the galaxy and the characters and universe are well fleshed out. The universe is quite expansive and you're free to run around and do as you please. If you like space games with lots of atmosphere, great humor and tons of upgrades and possibilities, you owe it to yourself to check this game out.

I owned the original version that was available on itch.io and received a key from the developer to help review and promote this game on Steam. You owe it to yourself to check it out as it is WELL worth the price of admission!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApAiwmZEMz0

Become the classic Harrison Ford characters in one (Han Solo and Indiana jones).
2D openworld space adventures.
Classic MSdos feel but with smooth high fps.
Mine materials and sell them.
Scavenge derelict ships for useful material to use or sell.
Buy new upgrades and sell your old ones.
Your basic travel and delivery missions.
Classic RPG style conversations with NPCs.

Development seems to going in the right directions. Just need a little more hand holding in the way of tutorials for more people to appreciate what the game truly has to offer.

8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ehhhhhhhhh, it's ok. the writing is sometimes cringey, the main character looks like what a manchild would idealize, and the story loses all of its magic immediately after the introduction, but the music is good and the gameplay is fun.

woulda been nice to have the crew kicking around with you, and to keep those fun character elements of the starting ship, like the split drive constantly bugging out. instead of expanding on that they just kinda dropped it entirely. sad, because it was actually really cool and immersive in a way that no other game in this genre's been able to manage, outside of maybe Star Control II.

Verdict: Buy Star Control II. Maybe buy this.
